flawed_nl_solution:
The second level has 90 + 8 = <<90+8=98>>98 parking spaces.
The third level has 98 + 12 = <<98+12=101>>101 parking spaces.
The fourth level has 101 - 9 = <<101-9=92>>92 parking spaces.
So the parking garage can accommodate 90 + 98 + 101 + 92 = <<90+98+101+92=381>>381 cars.
Thus, the parking garage can still accommodate 381 - 100 = <<381-100=281>>281 cars.
#### 281

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 110, not 101. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
